result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnathan K Nichols was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court costs and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 8/21/2017.  Nonpayment penalty shall  be a civil judgment.

Restitution set at zero.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Advance education.  At least part time employment.
Mental health assessmet and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Johnathan K Nichols

records.addlTxt: On 05/23/14 the court vacates the warrant and forfieture of signature bond.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($2,500 sig bond) gj

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Filed, signed Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment.  The Court Orders the petition for sentence adjustment is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, for review. jbs
on count one.

Defendant Johnathan K Nichols in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Phyllis M. DeCarvalho appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 1 YEAR and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 6 days.
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 8/21/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 8/21/2017; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Advance education
-At least part time employment
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed. No action taken. sab
Per Chief Judge Directive of 14-08, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2014 this case will be assigned to Branch 15, Judge J. D. Watts, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Johnathan K Nichols in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Johnathan K Nichols in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Court addresses the Justice Point report.  Defendant states he lost his phone and upon obtaining a new phone, immediately contacted Justice Point.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Johnathan K Nichols in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Bellows needs to review discovery with the defendant.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 26, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds
Original Motion Hearing Transcript (31 pages) commencing April 28, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Johnathan K Nichols in court with attorney Jessica Bellows.  William Levins for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Attorney Bellows has not received discovery yet.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

14RM027087  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05-24-14
The court amends the $2,500.00 signature bond to a $50.00 cash bond.  All conditions of bail to remain the same.

Defendant Johnathan K Nichols in court.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE
Defendant thought he was to be in court at 1:30 pm.  Court admonished defendant for not appearing at 8:30 am.  Court VACATES warrant and forfeiture of signature bond. Court orders defendant to report to the Public Defender's Office and provide the new court date.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed. cmt
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Rick D Steinberg in court.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Attorney Steinberg moves to withdraw.   Statments by counsel and defendant.  Court grants motion and allows Attorney Steinberg to withdraw subject to new counsel is in place.  Court refers defendant to the public defender's office.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Johnathan K Nichols in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Defendant states he didn't know the gun was there.  Court does not accept the defendant's guilty plea and will set case for jury trial.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Johnathan K Nichols in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  William Levins for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Johnathan K Nichols in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Hearing on motion to suppress due to lack of search warrant.  Sworn-in for the State:  Milwaukee Police Officer Jeffrey Pautzke.   State rests subject to rebuttal.  Sworn-in for the defense:  Milwaukee Police Officer Michael Flannery.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Testimony closed.  Arguments by counsel.  Court finds it was reasonable the vehicle contained evidence of the arrest and the officers were acting legally in the search.    Court denies motion to suppress.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 10:00 am.
State's Response to Motion to Suppress Search received and filed./ds
Notice of Motion and Defendant's Motion to Dismiss Due to Unconstitutional Search received and filed./ds

Defendant Johnathan K Nichols in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty.  Motions to be filed by 3-28-14; response/reply by 4-11-14.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING  commencing  FEBRUARY 26, 2014  received and filed. (15 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Rick Steinberg, Atty  12690 W North Avenue  #C  Brookfield, WI  53005.

Defendant Johnathan K Nichols in court with attorney Rick Steinberg.  William Levins for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
State informs the Court that this case is assigned to ADA Kevin Shomin, therefore should be reassigned to Judge Konkol in Branch 44.  Court took judical notice of certified documents regarding case #07CF1385 that are attached to the complaint.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Flannery-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty. Court allows defense counsel to withdraw his guilty plea at this time.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Arraignment scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 2/25/14.
css

Defendant Johnathan K Nichols in court with attorney Steve Sargent for Louis E Epps.  Hanna Kolberg for Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Counsel informs the Court that the defendant is in the process of obtaining private counsel and requesting an adjournment.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Court informs the defendant that the Preliminary Hearing will commence on the next scheduled court date with or without private counsel.  State Public Defender's Office will not be allowed to withdraw at this time.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Johnathan K Nichols in court with attorney Lisa Marie Schlieben.  Defendant Johnathan K Nichols in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
